instruction: 1. Cook rice according to package directions.
2. Pour 8 cups of water and 2 tsp. of salt in a large saucepot over medium-high heat.
3. Remove the tough ends from the asparagus and discard. Set the asparagus aside.
4. Pat dry the beef tenderloins with paper towels. Season each with 1/4 tsp. of salt and pepper on both sides.
5. Meanwhile, heat 1 Tbsp. of olive oil in a large non-stick sauté pan over medium-high heat.
6. When hot, add the beef tenderloins and sear on both sides for 5 min.

7. Pour teriyaki sauce into a small sauté pan and place over high heat. When it begins to boil, reduce heat to low and simmer until the sauce has thickened and reduced by half, about 3–4 min. Stir in the honey.
8. Place the asparagus in the boiling water and cook for approx. 4 min. The spears should bend slightly.
9. While the asparagus is cooking, slice the beef tenderloins against the grain into equal sized pieces.
10. Arrange the asparagus and beef onto two plates, and spoon the teriyaki reduction around the beef. Serve the rice on the side.
protocol.name: beef tenderloin with teriyaki reduction and asparagus
protocol.image: beef tenderloin with teriyaki reduction and asparagus.jpg

instruction: 1. Chop the onion.
2. Slice the carrots and celery into quarter-sized slices.
3. Season the short ribs with salt and pepper on both sides. Set aside.
4. Heat oil in a large heavy-bottom pot over high heat.
5. Prepare a charcoal grill for direct cooking over medium-high heat.
6. In the pot, sear the short ribs until golden brown crust forms, about 3 minutes per side.
7. Remove the short ribs, turn the heat down to medium and sauté the onions, carrots and celery until tender, about 10 minutes.
8. Add the ribs, Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce, chicken broth and brown sugar to the pot.
9. Stack ribs side by side so they cook evenly.
10. Turn the heat back up to high and bring the ingredients to a boil.
11. Cover the pot, turn the heat down to low and simmer for about an hour.
12. Once the meat is cooked, remove from the heat and allow it to cool in the liquid for 15 minutes.
13. Remove ribs from the pot and use a colander to strain the cooking liquid into a large bowl.
14. Pour the liquid back into the pot and then bring it to a boil.
15. Turn heat down to low and simmer for about 15 minutes or until the liquid has reduced by half the volume.
16. Place the ribs on the grill and cook until caramelized and heated through.
17. Brush ribs with the sauce and serve.
protocol.name: grilled teriyaki beef short ribs

instruction: 1. Cut the steak into 1½ inch cubes and place it in a shallow dish or resealable plastic container.
2. Pour the Island Teriyaki sauce over top and turn until evenly coated.
3. Cover and marinate in the fridge for 3½ hours.
4. When the meat is ready, discard any leftover marinade.
5. Soak the wooden skewers in water while prepping (for at least 30 minutes).
6. Chop the peppers and red onion into large squares.
7. Cut the pineapple into 1½ inch wedges.
8. Combine in a large mixing bowl and toss with olive oil and season to taste with salt and pepper.
9. Prepare a charcoal grill for direct cooking over medium-high heat.
10. Thread the beef, fruit, and vegetables onto skewers.
11. Cook the kebabs on the grill, turning occasionally, until veggies are tender and the beef has reached an internal temperature of 145ºF.
12. Baste with extra Island Teriyaki sauce.
13.   Serve immediately.
protocol.name: grilled steak pineapple and pepper kebabs
protocol.image: grilled steak pineapple and pepper kebabs.jpg

instruction: 1. Arrange the flank steak in a bowl or large resealable container and pour in the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce.
2. Turn until evenly coated.
3. Cover and marinate in the fridge for at least 45 minutes or longer for more flavor.
4.  Once the meat is ready, discard any leftover marinade.
5. Zest the lime.
6. In a small bowl, combine the honey, lime zest, and pepper flakes.
7. Prepare a charcoal grill for direct cooking over medium-high heat.
8. Grill steak to desired doneness, occasionally brushing with the steak with the honey mixture. Make sure a minimum internal temperature of at least 160ºF has been reached.
9. Let the steak rest for 5 minutes and serve.
protocol.name: veri veri honey lime steak

instruction: 1. Prepare rice according to package instructions.
2. Thinly slice the beef across the grain.
3. In a medium bowl, toss meat with the cornstarch. Set aside.
4. Coarsely chop the red onion and broccoli.
5. Remove the stems from the mushrooms and coarsely chop them.
6. Heat half of the vegetable oil in a large wok or non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat.
7. Cook the beef, stirring constantly, until medium rare, then remove from the pan.
8. Add remaining oil and stir-fry the onion, broccoli and mushrooms until tender.
9. After the veggies are done, stir in the beef, Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce and chili flakes.
10. Bring to a boil then lower the heat to medium-low and cook until everything is heated through, about 3 minutes.
11. Plate the stir-fry over hot rice. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: spicy beef stir fry

instruction: 1. Soak wooden skewers in water (for at least 30 minutes).
2. Cut the steak against the grain into 1/4 inch slices.
3. Arrange the meat in a bowl or resealable plastic container and pour the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce over top and turn meat until evenly coated.
4. Cover and marinate in the fridge for at least 30 minutes.
5. When meat is ready, discard any extra marinade.
6. Prepare a charcoal grill for direct cooking over medium-high heat.
7. Cut the bell peppers into 1-inch squares.
8. In a medium-size mixing bowl, toss the chopped peppers in the olive oil and season to taste with salt and pepper.
9. Thread a piece of beef down onto the middle of the skewer, starting at the end of the steak slice and going back and forth as if you were sewing.
10. Next thread 3 pieces of green pepper onto the skewer.
11. Add another piece of beef so you have meat on both sides of the green pepper.
12. Grill skewers for about 8 minutes, turning occasionally, until the beef is slightly charred on the outside and the peppers are tender.
13. Serve with additional Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce for dipping.
protocol.name: teriyaki flank steak and green pepper yakitori
protocol.image: teriyaki flank steak and green pepper yakitori.jpg

instruction: 1. Mince the garlic and ginger.
2. Combine the Toasted Sesame sauce, sherry (or apple juice), soy sauce, red pepper flakes, minced garlic, minced ginger and pepper in a large resealable bag.
3. Shake it until all the ingredients are combined
4. Add the steak to the bag and let it marinate in the fridge for an hour, or longer for a more robust flavor.
5. When your meat is ready, discard any extra marinade.
6. Prepare a charcoal grill for direct cooking over medium-high heat.
7. Thinly slice the scallions.
8. Cook the noodles according to package instructions.
9. Place the steak on the grill and cook until desired doneness. The meat should reach a minimum internal temperature of 145ºF. Keep the grill covered as much as possible to ensure even cooking.
10. When the meat is done, remove from the grill and let it rest for 5 minutes.
11. Slice the steak thinly against the grain and plate over the hot noodles.
12. Garnish with sesame seeds and scallions.
13. Serve hot.
protocol.name: sesame beef and noodles

instruction: 1. Arrange the steaks and pineapple slices in a shallow dish or resealable plastic container.
2. Pour the Island Teriyaki sauce over top and turn meat until evenly coated.
3. Cover and marinate it in the fridge for at least 3 hours, or up to 24 hours for a more robust flavor.
4. When meat is ready, discard any leftover marinade.
5. Prepare a charcoal grill for both direct and indirect cooking, placing the coals on one half of the grill.
6. Place the steak and pineapple slices directly over the coals and sear for a few minutes, until the outside starts to caramelize.
7. Remove the pineapple slices and set them to the side.
8. Move the steak to the indirect heat.
9. Cook to desired doneness, or until an internal temperature of at least 145ºF has been reached.
10. Let the steak rest for 5 minutes.
11. Top it with pineapple slices.
12. Serve hot.
protocol.name: hawaiian ribeyes

instruction: 1. Cut the meat between the bones to separate the ribs.
2. Score the meaty side of each rib and season liberally with salt and pepper.
3. In a large resealable bag, toss the ribs with the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce, coating the meat completely.
4. Remove as much air as possible from the bag, seal, and marinate in the fridge for at least 4 hours or overnight for more flavor.
5. Thinly slice the scallions.
6. Pour the ribs and marinade into a medium size stockpot.
7. Add the broth. The liquid should come about halfway up the sides of the meat. You can add more broth if necessary.
8. Bring to a boil then lower heat to a simmer and cover.
9. Cook the ribs on low heat for 2 hours, moving the meat around occasionally, until it's tender.
10. Remove ribs from the pot and set aside.
11. Using a ladle, skim as much fat off the top of the remaining sauce as possible.
12. Bring it to a boil, stirring often. Cook until the sauce is slightly reduced, about 10 minutes.
13. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
14. Pour the finished sauce over the ribs and garnish with the scallions and sesame seeds.
15. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: gangnam style braised short ribs

instruction: 1. Season steaks with salt and pepper on both sides.
2. Heat the oil in a heavy-bottom frying pan or cast iron skillet over medium-high heat.
3. Bring a large pot of water to boil (for the asparagus).
4. Place the asparagus in the boiling water and cook for about 4 minutes. The spears should bend slightly when picked up out of the water.
5. Sear steak in a heavy-bottom frying pan or cast iron skillet to desired doneness; about 5 minutes per side for medium-rare. Make sure meat has an internal temperature of at least 145ºF.
6. Remove it from the pan and let it rest for about 10 minutes.
7. Pour the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce into a small saucepan, and place over high heat on the stove.
8. As soon as it begins to boil, turn it down to a low simmer and continue to cook until the sauce has thickened and reduced by half; about 10 minutes.
9. Then stir in the honey.
10. Spoon the sauce around the steak for dipping. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: frisky filet mignon with teriyaki reduction
protocol.image: frisky filet mignon with teriyaki reduction.jpg

instruction: 1. Place the beef in a large mixing bowl.
2. Fold in the Island Teriyaki sauce and panko.
3. Cover and chill in the fridge for 1 hour or until ready to cook.
4. When your mixture is ready, shape the meat into 4 burger patties.
5. Prepare a charcoal grill for direct cooking over medium-high heat.
6. Seed the bell pepper and cut it into 4 pieces.
7. When your mixture is ready, shape the meat into 4 burger patties.
8. Grill the burgers to desired doneness. Make sure the patties reach an internal temperature of at least 160ºF.
9. Grill the bell pepper, pineapple rings and lightly toast the rolls.
10. Serve the burgers on the rolls each topped with the bell peppers and pineapple rings.
protocol.name: island teriyaki burger

instruction: 1. Place the steak and Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce in a large resealable bag and marinate in the fridge for 30 minutes or overnight for more flavor.
2. When the meat is ready, discard any leftover marinade.
3. Prepare a charcoal grill for direct cooking over medium-high heat.
4. Preheat oven to 425°F.
5. Grill the steak to desired doneness, about 3 minutes per side for medium-rare. Make sure it reaches a minimum internal temperature of 145ºF.
6. Let the steak rest for 5 minutes.
7. Cut into bite-sized pieces.
8. Pit and dice the avocado.
9. Grease 2 baking sheets with cooking spray.
10. Brush one side of each tortilla with cooking oil and place, oil side down, on the baking sheet.
11. Divide the cheese between the tortillas.
12. Layer with steak and avocado.
13. Top with remaining tortillas and bake, flipping once, until lightly browned and crispy, about 5 minutes per side.
14. Transfer to a cutting board and cut each quesadilla into triangles.
15. Serve with extra Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce and sour cream for dipping.
protocol.name: teriyaki carne asada quesadillas
integradient: shredded cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese

instruction: 1. Thinly slice the red onion.
2. Place the beef in a large mixing bowl.
3. Fold in the Hoisin Garlic sauce and black pepper.
4. Shape the meat into 4 burger patties, cover and chill until ready to cook.
5. Prepare a charcoal grill for direct cooking over medium-high heat.
6. Grill the burgers to desired doneness. Make sure the patties reach an internal temperature of at least 160ºF.
7. Lightly toast the buns on the grill.
8. Serve with sliced red onion and butter lettuce.
protocol.name: hamans hoisin hamburgers

instruction: 1. Preheat the oven to 400ºF.
2. Slice the onion into 1/2 inch rounds.
3. Thinly slice the scallions.
4. Spread half of the onion slices in an even layer on the bottom of a large roasting pan.
5. Place the brisket on top, and season with salt and pepper on both sides.
6. Pour half of the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce over the top and, using your hands, rub the sauce into the meat.
7. Flip the brisket and repeat with remaining sauce.
8. Pour the beef broth around the brisket.
9. Cover the top with aluminum foil and place in the oven.
10. Cook for 30 minutes.
11. Lower the heat to 325ºF.
12. Continue to cook until tender and an internal temperature of 160ºF has been reached, about 2½ hours.
13. Remove from oven and transfer meat to a cutting board.
14. Let sit for at least 20 minutes before slicing, until cool enough to handle.
15. Cut into thin slices against the grain of the meat.
16. Garnish with the scallions.
17. Serve with additional Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce on the side for dipping.
protocol.name: soy vay miracle brisket

instruction: 1. Prepare rice according to package instructions.
2. Trim the ends off the asparagus and cut the spears diagonally into 1 inch lengths.
3. Slice the steak into thin strips, cutting against the grain.
4. Heat the oil in a large frying pan or wok over high heat.
5. Cook the flank steak until browned on all sides; about 4 minutes.
6. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Remove the meat from the pan with a slotted spoon.
8. Drain the fat from the pan.
9. Add the asparagus to the pan and cook until tender, about 3 minutes.
10. Return the meat to the pan and add in the Hoisin Garlic sauce and cashews.
11. Stir until everything is thoroughly coated and warmed through.
12. Plate the stir-fry over rice.
13. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: garlic beef and asparagus stir fry
protocol.image: garlic beef and asparagus stir fry.jpg

instruction: 1. Arrange the steak in a shallow dish or large resealable plastic container.
2. Pour in half of the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce and turn meat until evenly coated.
3. Cover and marinate in the fridge for 12 hours.
4. Slice onions, tomatoes, kale and hoagie rolls. Set aside.
5. Prepare a charcoal grill for direct cooking over medium-high heat.
6. Cook the steak to desired doneness. Make sure meat reaches an internal temperature of at least 145°F.
7. When it’s done, remove from the grill and let rest for 20 minutes.
8. When the meat is ready, slice into thin strips.
9. In a medium-sized nonstick frying pan, heat the oil over high heat.
10. Sauté onions with remaining Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce until caramelized. Set aside.
11. Place the buns on the grill and heat until golden brown.
12. Stuff the buns with the sliced beef, caramelized onions, tomatoes and kale.
13. Put a toothpick on each side of the sandwich and slice down the middle.
14. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: veri veri steak sandwich from polkers
protocol.image: veri veri steak sandwich from polkers.jpg

instruction: 1. Along one side, diagonally score each hot dog.
2. Place the hot dogs in a shallow dish or resealable plastic bag.
3. Pour the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce over top and turn until all the hot dogs are evenly coated.
4. Marinate in the fridge for about 30 minutes.
5. Dice the red pepper and onion.
6. Prepare a charcoal grill for direct cooking over medium-high heat.
7. Heat the olive oil in a large nonstick frying pan over medium heat.
8. For the relish: sauté the red pepper and onion in the pan until tender.
9. Stir in mustard and season to taste with salt and pepper. Set aside.
10. Grill the hot dogs, turning occasionally, until lightly charred on the outside and heated through the middle; about 5 minutes.
11. Lightly toast the buns on the grill.
12. Place the hot dogs in the buns and top with a few spoonfuls of the relish.
13. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: teriyaki hot dogs with relish

instruction: 1. Prepare rice according to package instructions.
2. Chop the green onions.
3. In a large mixing bowl combine ground beef, onion, egg, breadcrumbs and the Veri Veri Teriyaki Sauce.
4. Knead the mixture with your hands until all the ingredients are incorporated.
5. Roll the meat mixture into balls about 2 inches in diameter.
6. In a large frying pan or wok, heat the vegetable over high heat.
7. Cook the meatballs until browned on all sides and an internal temperature of 160°F has been reached.
8. Drain and discard excess fat. Set the meatballs aside.
9. In a small saucepan over high heat, combine the pineapple juice, tomato juice, sherry, garlic powder and ginger powder.
10. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to medium-low.
11. Simmer for 5 minutes until sauce starts to thicken.
12. Pour the sauce over the meatballs and stir until everything is well coated.
13. Plate the meatballs over hot rice.
14. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: saucy asian meatballs

instruction: 1. For the short rib marinade: Combine the teriyaki sauce, soy sauce, liquid smoke, sorghum, dark brown sugar, onion powder, garlic powder, Gold sauce, 1 cup of the Worcestershire sauce, 1/2 tsp. of the chili flakes, 1 Tbsp. of the salt, and the Gold sauce in a bowl.
2. Place the short ribs in a bowl or dish, pour on the marinade, and marinate for at least 2 hours.
3. Meanwhile, for the pickled onions, heat a skillet on medium-low heat.
4. Add the vinegar, 1 cup of the sugar, cinnamon stick, cloves, allspice, bay leaf, peppercorns and remaining chili flakes to the pan, and simmer until the sugar dissolves.
5. Add the red onions and return pan to a simmer.

6. Line a sheet tray with parchment paper and transfer the onions to it, reserving the liquid in the pan. Turn the heat off so the liquid doesn't reduce, and allow the onions to cool in the fridge. Once cool, repeat this process 2 more times.
7. After the 3rd time, cool the liquid in the refrigerator as well.
8. Once both are completely cool, combine the onions and the liquid in a lidded container or Mason jar. (This keeps for up to 4 weeks).
9. Preheat the oven to 325°F.
10. Once both are completely cool, combine the onions and the liquid in a lidded container or mason jar. (this will keep for up to 4 weeks)
11. Preheat an oven to 325 degrees F.

12. For the remoulade: In a bowl, combine these ingredients in the order they are listed - mayonnaise, shallots, pickled okra, pickled garlic, horseradish, the juice of half a lemon, chopped dill, whole grain mustard, ketchup, the remaining Worcestershire sauce (should be 1/2 tsp.), paprika, a pinch of cayenne, the remaining salt (should be 1 tsp.), the zested garlic, pepper, the juice and zest of one lime, the zest of one lemon, green hot sauce and the oil.

13. For the Johnny cakes: In a bowl, combine the corn kernels, all purpose flour, cornmeal, baking powder, remaining sugar (should be 2 Tbsp.), melted butter, milk, buttermilk, eggs and honey, and mix into a batter.
14. Spread the benne seeds on a lined cookie sheet and toast at 325°F or until fragrant.
15. Preheat a grill to high heat.
16. Remove the ribs from the marinade and discard the marinade.
17. Cook the ribs over the hot grill until cooked through, then remove them from the grill and set aside, keeping them warm.
18. Heat a greased skillet to medium heat.
19. Cook the Johnny cake batter like pancakes, forming cakes 3 inches or so wide.
20. To assemble the final dish: Pull the meat off one short rib and shred it; top a Johnny cake with a tsp. of the remoulade and the shredded meat; garnish with kimchi, benne seeds and pickled onion.
21. Repeat this process until you have the desired amount of servings.
protocol.name: korean short rib johnny cakes w kimchi and pickled onion
protocol.image: korean short rib johnny cakes w kimchi and pickled onion.jpg
integradient: Korean short ribs, sliced 3/8" thick, bones removed

instruction: 1. Mix the chicken, brown sugar, salt and 3/4 oz. of the teriyaki sauce together, and combine completely.
2. Using a sausage stuffer, fill the casings with the mixture. Tie off the sausage into 4 equal-sized links.
3. Cook the rice and allow it to cool. (Can be done a day in advance).
4. Combine the rice and rice flour, and mix to evenly coat all of the rice. Don’t allow the rice to clump together; it should be dry and in separate pieces.
5. Grill the sausages until cooked through, at least 10 minutes. Set aside and let rest for 5 minutes.
6. Shake the excess flour from the rice and drop all of it into a deep fryer or frying pan with 1/2” of oil heated to 355°F. Fry the rice for 1 minute and drain on paper towels. Allow to cool.
7. In a mixing bowl combine the tatsoi, pineapple and pickled red onion.
8. Drizzle the remaining teriyaki sauce over the salad and squeeze in the lemon juice.
9. Toss the salad, split it equally onto 4 plates and garnish with the crispy rice.
10. Place 1 sausage on each plate.
protocol.name: teriyaki chicken sausage and salad with crispy rice
protocol.image: teriyaki chicken sausage and salad with crispy rice.jpg
integradient: cooked jasmine rice (cold and preferably one day old)

instruction: 1. In a food processor, combine the ginger, garlic and shallot and process until finely chopped, almost to a paste.
2. In a bowl, mix together the teriyaki sauce, hoisin sauce, fish sauce and rice vinegar. Set aside.
3. Place the sugar in a small heavy-bottomed saucepot.
4. Slowly heat over medium, wiping down the sides with a wet brush if crystals form, until the sugar becomes caramel/deep brown but not burnt (this will turn quickly, so take caution).
5. Slowly add the teriyaki liquid mixture to the caramel; be careful as it bubbles.
6. Once the caramel melts into the liquid, stir in the ginger, garlic and shallot paste.
7. Stir in the five-spice powder, then turn heat to medium-low.
8. Cook for 20 minutes and then cool completely.
9. Preheat the oven to 300°F.
10. Generously season the ribs on all sides with salt, black pepper and five-spice.
11. Place the ribs on a baking sheet and cover with foil.
12. Cook the ribs for approx. 2-2½ hours, or until tender. Remove them and let cool completely.
13. When ready to finish, preheat a grill to high heat.

14. Coat the ribs with the finished BBQ sauce and grill until smoky and heated through, basting with extra sauce as they cook and flipping occasionally, about 15-20 minutes. Be careful not to let the sauce burn.
15. While the ribs cook, crisp the garlic in oil until golden and drain on paper towels.
16. Serve the ribs garnished with crispy garlic slices, chopped scallions and cilantro.
protocol.name: leah cohens baby back ribs
integradient: kosher salt and ground black pepper, to taste
crispy garlic slices, chopped scallions and cilantro leaves for garnish

instruction: 1. Prepare rice according to package instructions.
2. Chop the onion.
3. Peel and dice the carrot. Slice the green parts of the scallions.
4. In a large non-stick frying pan or wok, cook the bacon until it's crispy.
5. Remove and drain excess oil.
6. Coarsely chop into bits.
7. In a small mixing bowl, coat the bacon with Spicy 'N Sweet Chili Heat marinade.
8. Whisk eggs together in a second small mixing bowl. Set aside.
9. Clean or dry the non-stick frying pan or wok.
10. Place it back on the stove and heat the oil over medium heat.
11. Sauté onion and carrots until tender.
12. Stir in eggs and cook until egg is firm, stirring occasionally.
13. Add the scallions, rice and bacon, and pour in the Toasted Sesame sauce.
14. Mix until everything is evenly coated and warmed through. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: spicy n sweet bacon fried rice
protocol.image: spicy n sweet bacon fried rice.jpg

instruction: 1. Cook ramen according to package directions.
2. Drain and rinse with cold water.
3. Slice the red peppers, scallions and bok choy.
4. Heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a large non-stick frying pan or wok over medium-high heat.
5. Add cooked noodles to wok, toss to coat with the oil.
6. Cook undisturbed for about 4 minutes until the bottom starts to turn golden.
7. Flip and cook until the other side is golden brown.
8. Once noodles are in a cake-like form, slide onto a plate. Set aside. (Option: divide noodles to create individual portions as shown in the picture.)
9. Once the noodles are done, add remaining oil and cook the pork until it's browned on all sides.
10. Add red pepper, carrots and scallions, and sauté until tender.
11. Fold in the bok choy and hoisin garlic sauce.
12. Cook until bok choy is wilted and everything is heated through.
13. Place mixture on top of the noodle cake. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: hoisin garlic chow mein noodle bowl
protocol.image: hoisin garlic chow mein noodle bowl.jpg

instruction: 1. Slice red onion into rounds.
2. Spread half the onions on the bottom of the Crock-Pot.
3. Season the pork roast with salt and pepper and place on top of the onions.
4. Pour the broth and Island Teriyaki sauce over the pork and cover with remaining onions.
5. Set the Crock-Pot to low and cook the pot roast for 6 hours.
6. When the meat is ready, remove from the pan.
7. Take a large spoon and skim the fat off the remaining sauce.
8. Serve the pork with sliced or cubed pineapple.
9. Spoon the sauce over top. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: crock pot teriyaki pork roast with pineapple
protocol.image: crock pot teriyaki pork roast with pineapple.jpg

instruction: 1. Preheat oven to 450ºF.
2. Thinly slice the scallions.
3. Scrub potatoes clean and rub with half the cooking oil.
4. Place on a large baking sheet and cook until the outside is crisp and inside is softened; about 1 hour.
5. Remove and leave oven on.
6. When the potatoes are cool enough to handle, slice in half lengthwise and scoop out the center leaving approx. 1/2 inch shell.
7. Dice the bacon and cook it in a large frying pan over medium heat.
8. When it starts to crisp, pour out the fat and add the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce.
9. Cook for another 4 minutes until bacon is evenly coated and has a glazed appearance.
10. Brush the top edges and inside surface of the potatoes with the remaining oil.
11. Divide the bacon and cheese evenly among the skins and bake for another 20 minutes until cheese has melted and the potatoes start to turn golden brown.
12. Place the potato skins on a platter and garnish with the scallions.
13. Serve with sour cream and additional Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce for dipping.
protocol.name: lucky loaded potato skins

instruction: 1. Peel and grate the ginger.
2. Shred the cabbage.
3. Chop the scallions.
4. In a small mixing bowl, lightly whisk the egg. Set aside.
5. Heat the vegetable oil in a large nonstick frying pan or wok over medium-high heat.
6. Cook the ginger until it turns slightly golden.
7. Add the ground chicken. Break up the meat with the back of your spoon as you cook it, until the meat is no longer pink.
8. Add the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce and fold in the cabbage and the white and light green parts of the scallions (reserve the dark green tips for garnish).
9. Cook covered until cabbage has wilted, about 4 minutes.
10. When it’s done, remove from the heat and allow to cool.
11. Place roughly 1 tablespoon of the chicken mixture in the center of each wonton wrapper.
12. With wet hands, fold the corners together in the center, pinch and slightly twist to seal.
13. Once all the dumplings are assembled, brush the tops with the egg.
14. Using a double boiler or steamer, steam the dumplings covered for about 10 minutes or until the wonton has softened and is heated through.
15. Garnish with remaining scallions and serve with some Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce on the side for dipping.
protocol.name: ginger teriyaki steamed dumplings

instruction: 1. Season the pork shoulder with salt and pepper.
2. Slice the onions.
3. Thinly slice the scallions.
4. In the bottom of a Crock-Pot, spread half of the onions in a single layer.
5. Place the pork shoulder on top.
6. Pour the chicken broth and half of the Toasted Sesame sauce over the pork and spread the remaining onions over the top.
7. Cover the Crock-Pot and cook on low for 8 hours.
8. In a large mixing bowl, combine the scallions with the coleslaw mix and the remaining Toasted Sesame sauce.
9. Toss until everything is evenly coated, cover, and place in the refrigerator to chill.
10. When pork is finished cooking, skim as much fat as possible from the surface of the cooking liquid with a ladle or large spoon and discard.
11. Shred the meat in the pot with two forks, removing any extra visible fat.
12. Stir well and keep warm in the cooking liquid.
13. Serve on toast topped with the slaw.
protocol.name: crock pot teriyaki pulled pork
integradient: shredded green cabbage or coleslaw mix

instruction: 1. Mix the chicken, brown sugar, salt and 3/4 oz. of the teriyaki sauce together, and combine completely.
2. Using a sausage stuffer, fill the casings with the mixture. Tie off the sausage into 4 equal-sized links.
3. Cook the rice and allow it to cool. (Can be done a day in advance).
4. Combine the rice and rice flour, and mix to evenly coat all of the rice. Don’t allow the rice to clump together; it should be dry and in separate pieces.
5. Grill the sausages until cooked through, at least 10 minutes. Set aside and let rest for 5 minutes.
6. Shake the excess flour from the rice and drop all of it into a deep fryer or frying pan with 1/2” of oil heated to 355°F. Fry the rice for 1 minute and drain on paper towels. Allow to cool.
7. In a mixing bowl combine the tatsoi, pineapple and pickled red onion.
8. Drizzle the remaining teriyaki sauce over the salad and squeeze in the lemon juice.
9. Toss the salad, split it equally onto 4 plates and garnish with the crispy rice.
10. Place 1 sausage on each plate.
protocol.name: teriyaki chicken sausage and salad with crispy rice
protocol.image: teriyaki chicken sausage and salad with crispy rice.jpg
integradient: cooked jasmine rice (cold and preferably one day old)

instruction: 1. Mince the mushrooms and garlic.
2. Peel and grate the carrot.
3. Separate the butter lettuce leaves.
4. Heat the canola oil in a large non-stick frying pan or wok over medium-high heat.
5. Cook the turkey until browned.
6. Next, add the mushrooms and garlic and cook until fragrant; about 1 minute.
7. Toss in the carrots, cabbage and hoisin garlic sauce. Stir until everything is evenly coated and cooked through.
8. Cover for about 2 minutes.
9. Let cool down for a few minutes.
10. Spoon the meat and vegetable mixture into each butter lettuce leaf.
11. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: turkey lettuce cups

instruction: 1. Arrange the chicken in a bowl or large resealable container and pour in the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce.
2. Turn until everything is evenly coated.
3. Cover and let the chicken marinate in the fridge for at least 45 minutes (up to 2 hours).
4. Discard the leftover marinade.
5. Chop the shallots, Serrano chilies, cilantro, parsley, ginger and garlic.
6. Thinly slice the cabbage, and scallions.
7. Peel the cucumber and remove the seeds.
8. Julienne the cucumber and the bell peppers.
9. Season chicken with a bit of the black pepper.
10. Cook the udon noodles according to package instructions.
11. Drain and rinse to cool. Set aside.
12. Prepare a charcoal grill for direct cooking over medium-high heat.
13. Grill chicken until golden brown and an internal temperature of 165°F has been reached, about 6 minutes per side.
14. Remove from grill and allow to rest for 5 minutes.
15. Place the Serrano chilies, cilantro, Italian parsley, shallots, ginger and garlic in a blender along with the salt, pepper, rice vinegar and sesame oil.
16. Puree the mixture on low then drizzle in the olive oil as you increase the speed until dressing is emulsified.
17. In a large mixing bowl, combine udon noodles, dressing, cucumber, cabbage, scallions, red and yellow peppers, and carrots. Gently mix to fully incorporate all ingredients.
18. Slice the chicken and plate with the udon noodle salad. Garnish with slivered almonds and serve.
19. Recipe courtesy of Chef Michael Laukert, Hundred Acre / One True Vine. All rights reserved.
protocol.name: grilled chicken teriyaki with udon noodle salad
protocol.image: grilled chicken teriyaki with udon noodle salad.jpg
integradient: small (each) red and yellow bell peppers, (or ¾ cup julienned)

instruction: 1. Soak wooden skewers in water while prepping (for at least 30 minutes).
2. Cut the chicken, peppers, onions and mushrooms into 2-inch cubes.
3. Place in a bowl or large resealable container and pour in the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce (leaving some for basting). Turn until everything is evenly coated.
4. Let ingredients marinate for at least 15 minutes.
5. When it’s ready, discard any leftover marinade.
6. Prepare a charcoal grill for direct cooking over medium-high heat.
7. Thread the chicken and vegetables onto the skewers.
8. Place the skewers on the grill, turning frequently until chicken is cooked through and browned on all sides.
9. Brush with additional Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce for more flavor.
10. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: teriyaki grilled chicken kebabs
integradient: large red, yellow or green bell pepper

instruction: 1. Arrange the drumsticks in a shallow dish or resealable plastic container.
2. Season with salt and pepper.
3. Pour 1/3 cup of the Hoisin Garlic sauce over the meat and turn until evenly coated.
4. Cover and marinate in the fridge for 2 hours.
5. Discard any leftover marinade.
6. Dice the tomatoes.
7. If needed, boil the corn for about 3 minutes, until tender. Set aside.
8. Prepare a charcoal grill for both direct (medium-high heat) and indirect cooking, placing the coals on one half of the grill.
9. Grill the chicken directly over the coals for about 9 minutes. Keep the lid closed as much as possible to ensure even cooking.

10. Move the chicken to the indirect heat and continue to cook for another 30 minutes, until the juices run clear and an internal temperature of 165ºF has been reached. Baste occasionally with remaining Hoisin Garlic sauce.
11. For the salad: cut the kernels off the cob.
12. In a large mixing bowl, toss corn with the tomatoes and olive oil.
13. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
14. Garnish with fresh basil.
15. Serve the salad and drumsticks together.
protocol.name: grilled hoisin garlic drumsticks

instruction: 1. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce, rice vinegar, mustard and duck sauce.
2. Place the chicken in the bowl and turn until evenly coated. Cover and marinate in the fridge for at least 30 minutes or up to 24 hours.
3. When meat is ready, discard any leftover marinade.
4. Preheat the oven to 450ºF.
5. Place the chicken into a casserole dish or broiler pan.
6. Bake for about 40 minutes. Flip it once to make sure it's evenly cooked. Chicken should be golden brown and have an internal temperature of at least 165ºF.
7. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: far out chicken teriyaki
integradient: duck sauce (substitute apricot jam if needed)

instruction: 1. Preheat oven to 300°F.
2. Thinly slice the scallions.
3. Pour the Island Teriyaki sauce into a Crock-Pot and warm it up on low.
4. Spread chicken wings evenly across a lipped cookie sheet and bake for 40 minutes.
5. Remove the chicken from oven and drain excess any fat.
6. Place the wings in the Crock-Pot and cook on high for 2 hours (or on low/warm for 3 hours).
7. Garnish with the scallions and sesame seeds.
8. Serve hot.
protocol.name: crock pot wings

instruction: 1. Using a large frying pan, heat up about 1/8 inch of oil over medium heat.
2. Chop up the avocado and red pepper.
3. Prepare the chicken and edamame if necessary. Set aside.
4. In a medium-size mixing bowl, whisk together the Spicy ’N Sweet Chili sauce and mayonnaise.  Set aside.
5. Slice the wonton wrappers in half diagonally, making a triangle.
6. Place some paper towels on a large plate to drain the wrappers after they’re fried.
7. When the oil is hot but not smoking, add a few wonton triangles to the pan.
8. Cook until the wrappers blister and start to turn golden brown around the edges.
9. Flip and continue to cook until the other side has turned golden brown, about 45 seconds for each batch.
10. Transfer to paper towels and sprinkle with salt.  Cook the wontons a few at a time until you’ve gotten through all 24 triangles.
11. When the wonton wrappers are all cooked, spread them out on a platter.
12. Top with the avocado, red pepper, chicken, edamame and red pepper flakes.
13. Drizzle a little bit of the sauce over the top of the nachos and serve the rest on the side for dipping.
protocol.name: winners chili wonton nachos

instruction: 1. Arrange the chicken breasts in a shallow dish or resealable plastic container.
2. Pour the Island Teriyaki sauce over top and turn chicken until evenly coated.
3. Cover and marinate in the fridge for about 2 hours.
4. When chicken is ready, you should discard any leftover marinade.
5. Prepare a charcoal grill for direct cooking over medium-high heat.
6. Slice the tomato and red onion.
7. Grill the chicken until golden brown and an internal temperature of 165ºF has been reached, about 4 minutes per side. Keep the lid on as much as possible to ensure even cooking.
8. Place the sandwich bread on the grill and toast until golden brown.
9. Spread the mayo and Dijon mustard onto 4 slices of the toasted bread.
10. Place the chicken on those 4 slices.
11. Top with the pineapple, spinach, tomato and onion and the other 4 slices of bread.
12. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: island chicken sandwich

instruction: 1. Chop the water chestnuts, green onions, celery and carrots.
2. Dice the red bell pepper.
3. Chop the cashews coarsely, if necessary.
4. Place the veggies in a large mixing bowl. Set aside.
5. Place the chicken in the bottom of a medium size stockpot.
6. Pour in enough water to cover chicken by an inch or so.
7. Bring the water to a boil.
8. Reduce heat to low and simmer the chicken breast until they reach an internal temperature of at least 165ºF, about 15 minutes.
9. Cut the cooked chicken into 1/2-inch pieces and add it to the bowl with the chopped vegetables.
10. Add in the cashews (leaving a few for garnish, if desired) and toss with the Toasted Sesame sauce until everything is evenly coated.
11. Cover and let the salad chill in the fridge for 1 hour or until ready to serve.
12. Arrange the butter lettuce leaves on your plate and top with the chicken and vegetable mixture.
13. Garnish with additional cashews.
14. Serve cold.
protocol.name: cashew chicken salad

instruction: 1. In a large bowl, combine half of the Toasted Sesame sauce, sherry, soy sauce, honey, sriracha, red pepper flakes (if desired), ginger and garlic.
2. Arrange drumettes in a shallow dish or resealable plastic container.
3. Pour the sauce over top and turn until evenly coated.
4. Cover and marinate in the fridge for 2 hours, turning occasionally.
5. When your meat is ready, discard any leftover marinade.
6. Preheat oven to 350ºF.
7. Cook the chicken for 45 minutes, or until an internal temperature of at least 165ºF has been reached.  Baste with juices every 15 minutes.
8. Let the chicken cool for 10 minutes in the pan.
9. Place the drumettes on a platter and serve with remaining Toasted Sesame sauce for dipping.
protocol.name: spicy ginger drumettes
integradient: sriracha sauce (or more if you like it spicy)

instruction: 1. Thinly slice the scallions, separating the white from the green parts.
2. Place the chicken breasts in a large stockpot.
3. Pour in enough broth so meat is covered by about an inch.
4. Bring to a boil then turn heat down to medium-low.
5. Cover and cook until the chicken shreds easily with a fork, about 1 hour.
6. Shred all the chicken and set aside.
7. Warm the tortillas.
8. Heat the oil in a large nonstick frying pan or wok over medium-high heat.
9. Add the whites of the scallion to the pan first and cook until slightly softened, about 2 minutes.
10. Add coleslaw mix and water.
11. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the cabbage has softened and the water has evaporated, about 4 minutes.
12. Stir in the shredded chicken and Hoisin Garlic sauce and cook until everything is warmed through and evenly coated.
13. Fold in the green parts of the scallions.
14. Spread extra hoisin garlic sauce over warm tortillas and top with filling.
15. Roll it up and serve immediately.
protocol.name: mu shu chicken

instruction: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F.
2. Rub both sides of the meat with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
3. Place the meat in a casserole dish or broiler pan and cook until juices run clear and an internal temperature of 165°F has been reached, about 10 minutes.
4. Remove from pan, dice and set aside.
5. Prepare rice according to package instructions.
6. Whisk egg in a small mixing bowl.
7. Thinly slice the scallions.
8. Heat the remaining olive oil in a large nonstick frying pan or wok over medium-high heat.
9. Cook the egg first, stirring to scramble.
10. When it’s done, remove eggs from the pan and set aside.
11. Sauté the white and light green parts of the scallions until tender, about 2 minutes (save the dark green tips for garnish).
12. Then add the frozen vegetables and cook until defrosted and softened, about 4 minutes.
13. Add the egg back into the pan along with the chicken, prepared rice and Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce.
14. Stir until everything is evenly coated and heated through.
15. Garnish with remaining scallions.
16. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: teriyaki chicken fried rice
integradient: frozen mixed vegetables (peas, carrots, corn and green beans)

instruction: 1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, pepper, paprika, cayenne pepper and garlic powder.
2. Roll each of the wings into the mixture until they're evenly coated.

3. Place the wings in a shallow dish or resealable plastic container, cover, and let the meat chill in the fridge for 1 hour. (Optional: After the chicken is done chilling, you can coat the wings with seasoning a second time for even more flavor.)
4. Heat the vegetable oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat.
5. In a medium size saucepan, combine butter and Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce over medium heat.
6. Stir it occasionally, and cook until mixture is melted and thickens slightly; about 5 minutes.
7. Deep-fry the wings until cooked through and crispy, about 10 minutes. Make sure the meat reaches an internal temperature of at least 165°F.
8. As you finish frying the wings, add them to the saucepan and toss until evenly coated.
9. Arrange the wings on a platter and garnish with sesame seeds. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: veri veri teriyaki wings
integradient: vegetable oil or shortening for frying

instruction: 1. Prepare the chicken breasts first: Preheat oven to 400°F.
2. Rub both sides of the meat with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
3. Place the meat in a casserole dish or broiler pan. Cook until juices run clear and an internal temperature of 165°F has been reached, about 10 minutes.
4. Remove from pan, dice and set aside.
5. Chop the lettuce and dice the apple.
6. In a large mixing bowl, toss the chicken, lettuce, apple and almonds with the Toasted Sesame sauce until everything is evenly coated.
7. Cover and chill until ready to serve.
protocol.name: cha cha chinese chicken salad

instruction: 1. Slice the onions into 1/4 inch rings.
2. Chop the mushrooms.
3. Season the onions and mushrooms with salt and pepper.
4. On a separate plate, season the chicken with salt and pepper as well.
5. Prepare a charcoal grill for direct cooking over medium-high heat.
6. Lay a piece of foil down on the grill and add the onion slices and mushrooms. Grill until softened.
7. Add the chicken to the grill. The chicken will need to cook for about 10 minutes per side, or until it reaches an internal temperature of at least 165°F.
8. When the chicken is done, remove from the grill and slice.
9. In a medium mixing bowl toss the chicken, onions and mushrooms with the Island Teriyaki sauce.
10. If you have a cooking stone, place it on the grill.
11. Roll the pizza dough out to the desired size, if necessary.
12. Brush the pizza dough with olive oil, and lightly season with salt and pepper.
13. Place on the grill (or pizza stone) and cook, flipping once, until both sides are slightly golden.
14. Layer the cheese, chicken, onions and mushrooms on the crust and continue to cook until cheese is melted.
15. Remove from grill.
16. Top with arugula and a drizzle of more Island Teriyaki sauce.
17. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: island grilled pizza
integradient: store-bought pizza dough (or make your own ahead of time)

instruction: 1. Rinse and separate the butter lettuce leaves.
2. Finely chop the red onion, carrots and cilantro.
3. Juice the lime.
4. In a large mixing bowl, toss the chicken, onion, carrots and cilantro with the Toasted Sesame sauce.
5. Divide the chicken mixture among the lettuce leaves, using each leaf like a cup.
6. Squeeze lime juice over each of the cups.
7. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: rotisserie chicken lettuce cups

instruction: 1. Finely slice the chili peppers.
2. Place the chicken breasts in a large stockpot and pour in enough water so meat is covered by about an inch.
3. Bring to a boil then turn heat down to medium-low.
4. Cover and cook until the chicken shreds easily with a fork, about 1 hour. Set aside.
5. In a medium mixing bowl, combine the shredded chicken with the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce.
6. In a separate medium mixing bowl, toss coleslaw vegetables and chili peppers with the vinegar.
7. Heat tortillas until slightly brown and malleable.
8. In a small mixing bowl, mix together mayonnaise and sriracha.
9. Place the chicken into the tortillas and top with vegetables and sriracha mayonnaise.
10. Garnish with cilantro.
11. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: asian tacos

instruction: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F.
2. Thinly slice the scallions.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the scallions with the ground turkey, water chestnuts and half of the Island Teriyaki sauce.
4. Add a pinch of salt and pepper, and knead the mixture with your hands until all the ingredients are incorporated.
5. Roll the meat mixture into balls about 2 inches in diameter.

6. On a greased, lipped cookie sheet, evenly space out the meatballs and bake them about 20 minutes. Shake the pan once during cooking so the meatballs flip over. Make sure the meat reaches an internal temperature of at least 165ºF.
7. Toast the buns and spread the remaining Island Teriyaki sauce on both sides.
8. Place a meatball on each bun, and top with a piece of lettuce.
9. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: turkey meatball sliders

instruction: 1. Prepare rice according to package instructions.
2. Chop the broccoli, mushrooms, celery and snow peas.
3. Drain the pineapple chunks. Set aside.
4. Heat the oil in a large nonstick frying pan or wok over medium-high heat.
5. Cook the chicken in the pan until the juices run clear and the meat has reached an internal temperature of at least 165°F.
6. Remove the meat from the pan.
7. Once it’s cool enough to handle, dice the chicken and set aside.
8. Add the broccoli, mushrooms, celery, snow peas and pineapple chunks to the pan along with the Island Teriyaki sauce.
9. Stirring often, cook the veggies until tender.
10. Add the diced chicken back to the pan and stir until everything is evenly coated and heated through.
11. Plate the veggies over hot rice.
12. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: island teriyaki chicken and vegetables

instruction: 1. Prepare rice according to package instructions.
2. In a large mixing bowl combine the soy sauce and cornstarch.
3. Cut the chicken into bite-sized chunks and place it into the bowl.
4. Stir until all the meat is evenly coated.
5. Cover and marinate in the fridge for at least 1 hour or longer for more flavor.
6. Discard any leftover marinade.
7. Chop the celery and bell pepper.
8. In an ungreased skillet, toast the cashews over medium heat until they turn golden brown. Set aside.
9. Heat the 1 tbsp of vegetable oil in a large nonstick frying pan or wok over medium-high heat.
10. Cook the chicken until all the juices run clear and it’s reached an internal temperature of at least 165°F.
11. Remove from the pan and keep warm.
12. Add remaining oil and stir-fry the celery, bell pepper and bamboo shoots until tender.
13. In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together the Hoisin Garlic sauce, broth, sherry and sesame oil.
14. Pour the mixture into the pan along with the chicken and nuts.
15. Stirring constantly, cook until the sauce starts to thicken and everything is heated through.
16. Plate over hot rice. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: stir fry chicken and vegetables

instruction: 1. Chop the cabbage, mushrooms, green onions and carrots.
2. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large nonstick frying pan or wok over high heat.
3. Brown the turkey, breaking it up until it’s no longer pink.
4. Drain the fat and discard.
5. Add the cabbage, mushrooms, onions, carrots, ginger and chicken broth to the pan.
6. Stir-fry until liquid has evaporated, about 6 minutes.
7. Stir in the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce and mix until everything is evenly coated and heated through.
8. Brush one of the wonton wrappers lightly with water.
9. Place 1 tablespoon of the meat filling in the center of each wrapper.
10. Bring up the edges to enclose filling and twist firmly to seal.
11. Repeat until all the filling has been used.
12. Rinse and wipe out the pan.
13. Over medium heat, warm the remaining oil in the skillet.
14. Cook the potstickers until golden brown, about 5 minutes per batch.
15. Serve hot with extra Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce on the side for dipping.
protocol.name: wok of fame pot sticker bundles
protocol.image: wok of fame pot sticker bundles.jpg

instruction: 1. Prepare the rice according to package instructions.
2. Place the chicken in a large resealable bag.
3. Cover with Island Teriyaki sauce and turn until evenly coated.
4. Marinate in the fridge for at least 1 hour, or overnight for more flavor. Reserve any unused marinade for cooking.
5. Thinly slice the red onions.
6. Peel, pit and cube the mango. Set aside.
7. In a large nonstick frying pan heat the olive oil over medium-high heat.
8. Sauté the onion for about 2 minutes, until tender.
9. Add the chicken along with the extra marinade to the pan.
10. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to medium.
11. Stirring occasionally, cook the chicken until it has reached an internal temperature of at least 165°F; about 6 minutes.
12. Add the mango and red pepper flakes.
13. Cook for another 2 minutes, stirring gently but constantly until the ingredients are warmed through.
14. Plate over hot rice.
15. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: island teriyaki mango chicken

instruction: 1. Thinly slice the scallions, separating the white from the green parts.
2. Peel and mince the garlic cloves.
3. Season chicken with salt and pepper.
4. Heat the oil in a heavy-bottomed saucepan over high heat.
5. Cook the chicken thighs, skin-side down until golden brown; about 5 minutes.
6. Flip over and cook another 3 minutes.
7. Remove from pan and set aside.
8. Turn heat down to medium and add the white parts of the scallions, garlic and mushrooms.
9. Sauté until mushrooms are slightly tender, about 3 minutes.
10. Add chicken thighs back into pot and pour in the chicken broth and Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce.
11. Bring to a boil, cover, and then turn heat down to low.
12. Simmer for 25 minutes.
13. Remove the lid and simmer for another 10 minutes.
14. Garnish with remaining scallion greens.
15. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: teriyaki braised chicken thighs
integradient: sliced cremini or shiitake mushrooms (8 oz.)

instruction: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F.
2. Rub both sides of the meat with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
3. Place the meat in a casserole dish or broiler pan and cook until juices run clear and an internal temperature of 165°F has been reached; about 10 minutes.
4. Remove from the pan and shred the meat using 2 forks.
5. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chicken with the Toasted Sesame sauce and mix until evenly coated.
6. Cover and chill in the fridge until ready to use.
7. Drain and cut the bamboo shoots into strips.
8. Chop the lettuce, green onion, peanuts and cilantro.
9. Grate the carrots.
10. Slice the lime into small wedges.
11. Heat the vegetable oil in a large frying pan over high heat.
12. Fry the egg roll wrappers one at a time until lightly golden but still pliable.
13. Fold in half to form a large triangle (like a hard taco shell) and continue frying until crisp.
14. Drain on paper towels and repeat with remaining wrappers.
15. Place the chicken mixture into the "shells" and top with the chopped veggies and peanuts.
16. Garnish with limes.
17. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: chinese chicken tacos

instruction: 1. Place the salmon fillets in a casserole dish. Pour the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce over top and turn the fish until evenly coated.
2. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge to marinate for 1 hour.
3. When the salmon is ready, discard any leftover marinade.
4. Preheat the oven to 425ºF. Adjust the rack to the center of the oven.
5. Line a baking sheet with foil or parchment paper.
6. Place the broccoli, kale and garlic on the baking sheet.
7. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Toss to coat.
8. Nestle the salmon fillets between the vegetables and cook for 15 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the salmon is cooked through.
9. Zest the lemon over the salmon and vegetables.
10. Sprinkle lightly with red pepper flakes before serving.
protocol.name: teriyaki salmon with baby broccoli and kale
protocol.image: teriyaki salmon with baby broccoli and kale.jpg

instruction: 1. Peel and devein the shrimp, if necessary.
2. Heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat.
3. Sauté the shrimp.
4. When they just start to turn pink, add the island teriyaki sauce and continue to sauté until the shrimp are cooked through.
5. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cabbage, pineapple, onion, cilantro, lime juice and salt. Toss until everything is evenly coated.
6. Heat the tortillas by placing them in a dry, heated skillet for 1-2 minutes per side.
7. Spoon a few shrimp into each tortilla and top with the cabbage and pineapple slaw.
8. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: island shrimp tacos with cabbage and pineapple slaw
protocol.image: island shrimp tacos with cabbage and pineapple slaw.jpg

instruction: 1. Pour the Veri Veri teriyaki sauce, brown sugar and orange juice together in large resealable plastic bag.
2. Shake to mix.
3. Place the salmon in the bag let it marinate in the fridge for 2 hours.
4. When the salmon is ready, discard any leftover marinade.
5. Soak a cedar or alder grill plank in water for 30 minutes.
6. Thinly slice the lemon.
7. Preheat a charcoal grill for direct cooking over medium-high heat.
8. Arrange the fish on the plank, skin side down.
9.  Sprinkle with fresh rosemary and add lemon slices.

10. Place the plank directly onto the grill grate, close the lid, and cook for 20 minutes. When you're done, the meat should be opaque, flake easily with a fork, and have an internal temperature of at least 145°F.
11. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: citrus salmon

instruction: 1. Peel and devein shrimp if necessary.
2. Season with salt and pepper.
3. Mince the garlic.
4. Heat the olive oil in a large nonstick frying pan or wok over medium-high heat.
5. Add the garlic to the pan.
6. When the garlic starts to turn golden brown, add the shrimp.
7. Sauté until the shrimp starts to turn pink and is mostly cooked through, about 5 minutes.
8. Add the Island Teriyaki sauce and coconut milk.
9. Bring to a boil and then lower the temperature to low and simmer for about 4 minutes until the sauce has reduced slightly.
10. Add basil leaves (leaving a few for garnish) and stir until wilted.
11. Garnish with sliced basil leaves. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: coconut teriyaki shrimp with basil stir fry
protocol.image: coconut teriyaki shrimp with basil stir fry.jpg

instruction: 1. Prepare rotini according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
2. Dice the red bell pepper, green onions and cucumber.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the pasta, red bell pepper, green onions, cucumber, pimentos and salmon.
4. Toss with the lemon juice, Toasted Sesame sauce, cayenne pepper and dried dill until everything is thoroughly coated.
5. Cover and chill for at least an hour.
6. Mix well before serving.
protocol.name: pasta salmon salad

instruction: 1. Chop the scallions. Set aside.
2. Arrange salmon in a shallow dish or resealable plastic container.
3. Pour 1/2 cup of the Miso Vinaigrette sauce over the fish and turn until evenly coated.
4. Cover and marinate in the fridge for 3 hours.
5. Discard any leftover marinade.
6. Preheat oven to 425°F.
7. Arrange the fillets on a foil lined baking sheet.
8. Brush or baste the tops with the remaining Miso Vinaigrette sauce.
9. Bake for about 12 minutes. The meat should be opaque, flake easily with a fork, and have an internal temperature of at least 145°F.
10. When the fish is done, brush with a final bit of Miso Vinaigrette sauce.
11. Season with a pinch of salt.
12. Garnish with toasted sesame seeds and scallions.
13. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: miso glazed baked salmon

instruction: 1. Chop the lettuce, watercress, green apple and avocado.
2. Peel and segment the grapefruit.
3. Clean and devein the shrimp (if necessary).
4. Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat.
5. Sauté the shrimp until cooked through.
6. Arrange the lettuce, watercress, apple, avocado and grapefruit on a plate and top with the cooked shrimp.
7. Dress with the Citrus ‘N Ginger sauce.
8. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: seafood citrus salad
integradient: heads of butter lettuce (about 8 cups chopped)

instruction: 1. Prepare rice according to package instructions.
2. Clean and devein shrimp, if necessary.
3. Thinly slice the onion.
4.  Thinly slice the dark green part of the scallions (for garnish).
5. Heat the oil in a large nonstick frying pan or wok over medium-high heat.
6. Sauté the onion until tender; about 2 minutes.
7. Add the shrimp and cook until it starts to turn pink.
8. Mix in the Spicy ‘N Sweet Chili Heat sauce and continue to cook until the shrimp are pink and thoroughly cooked.
9. Serve shrimp over the cooked rice and garnish with scallions.
protocol.name: spicyn sweet chili heat simple shrimp
protocol.image: spicyn sweet chili heat simple shrimp.jpg

instruction: 1. Arrange the fish in a shallow dish or large resealable plastic container.
2. Pour the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce over top and turn fillets until evenly coated.
3. Slice an orange and place the slices on top of the fish.
4. Cover and marinate in the fridge for at least an hour, or longer for more flavor.
5. When fish is ready, discard any leftover marinade and reserve the orange slices.
6. Prepare a charcoal grill for direct cooking over medium heat.
7. Grill the fish for about 7 minutes per side. The meat should be opaque, flake easily with a fork, and have an internal temperature of at least 145°F.
8. Grill the orange slices and use as a garnish.
9. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: orange teriyaki halibut

instruction: 1. Preheat oven to 450ºF.
2. Slice the lemon into wedges.
3. In a small bowl, mix together the Island Teriyaki and the mayonnaise.
4. Spread a thin layer of the sauce over each salmon fillet and sprinkle with garlic salt.
5. Arrange salmon on a foil-lined baking sheet.
6. Place on the bottom rack and bake for about 20 minutes.  The meat should be opaque, flake easily with a fork, and have an internal temperature of at least 145°F.
7. Serve with lemon wedges and extra sauce on the side for dipping.
protocol.name: slow broiled teriyaki salmon

instruction: 1. Mince the shallots.
2. Mix in the shallots and Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce into the melted butter. (If the butter in the sauce starts to harden, you may need to warm it up again.)
3. Season salmon with salt and pepper on both sides.
4. Prepare a charcoal grill for direct cooking over medium-high heat.

5. Grill the fish for about 5 minutes on each side, basting the fillets with the sauce as it cooks. The meat should be opaque, flake easily with a fork, and have an internal temperature of at least 145°F.
6. When the fish is done, remove from the grill and drizzle with extra sauce.
7. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: grilled salmon with teriyaki shallot butter
protocol.image: grilled salmon with teriyaki shallot butter.jpg

instruction: 1. Dice the tuna.
2. In a large mixing bowl, toss the fish with 1/3 cup of the Toasted Sesame sauce until evenly coated.
3. Cover and marinate in the fridge for 30 minutes, or up to 4 hours for more flavor.
4. Thinly slice the scallions.
5. Dice the avocado.
6. Gently fold the scallions and avocado into the tuna mixture.
7. Fold in the macadamia nuts.
8. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
9. Scoop the tuna mixture into the center of each of the lettuce leaves.
10. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: toasted sesame tuna poke lettuce cups
protocol.image: toasted sesame tuna poke lettuce cups.jpg

instruction: 1. Peel, seed and slice the cucumber into matchsticks.
2. Make sure shrimp is peeled, deveined, and cooked.
3. Slice the shrimp in half lengthwise.
4. Toss with 2 tablespoons of the Spicy ’N Sweet Chili sauce. Set aside.
5. Using a shallow dish or cake pan, soak 2 rounds of the rice paper in hot water until softened; about 45 seconds.
6. Gently place one of the rounds on a paper towel, and blot the top to dry.
7. Remove the other round from the water, blot both sides to dry, and place on top of the first round so you have a double layer.
8. Place a butter lettuce leaf on the bottom half of the round, leaving a 1-inch border on the bottom and sides.
9. In a row across the center, layer the basil and mint leaves, cucumber sticks and 4 shrimp halves.

10. Keeping your fingers wet, roll the rice paper over the filling once, then fold in the sides to enclose the filling. Continue rolling until you’ve used up the rice paper round and the spring roll is sealed.
11. Repeat with remaining rice paper and ingredients.
12. Cut each roll in half and serve with remaining Spicy ’N Sweet Chili sauce for dipping.
protocol.name: shrimp spring rolls with teriyaki
integradient: 8-inch rounds rice paper (plus some extra in case some tear)

instruction: 1. Cut striped bass into serving-sized portions.
2. Rinse the fish.
3. Check for and remove bones.
4. Arrange the bass in a shallow bowl or large resealable bag.
5. Leaving a small amount for basting, pour in the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce and turn fish until evenly coated.
6. Cover and marinate in the fridge for about 2 hours. When your fish is ready, discard any leftover marinade.
7. Prepare a charcoal grill for direct cooking over medium-high heat.

8. Grill the fish, brushing regularly with fresh Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce, for about 10 minutes per side. The meat should be opaque, flake easily with a fork, and have an internal temperature of at least 145°F.
9. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: grilled teriyaki striped bass

instruction: 1. Preheat oven to 350°F.
2. Grease a medium size baking dish with about 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
3. Arrange the fish on the baking sheet.
4. Brush the tops with remaining olive oil and season with garlic powder, onion powder, black pepper and red pepper flakes.
5. Pour the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce over the fillets.
6. Bake the fish for about 20 minutes. The meat should be opaque, flake easily with a fork, and have an internal temperature of at least 145°F.
7. In a small bowl, combine the sour cream, horseradish and ranch.
8. Plate the fish and finish with a dollop of the dip.
9. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: baked teriyaki salmon

instruction: 1. Cook the noodles according to package instructions. Be careful not to overcook.
2. When the noodles are done, drain and rinse under cold water to wash away any extra starches.
3. Thinly slice the green onions.
4. Mince the garlic.
5. Thinly slice the cucumber into half moons.
6. Core and cut the bell pepper into thin strips.
7. Slice the avocado into strips.
8. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the toasted sesame sauce, vinegar, green onions and garlic.
9. Add the noodles, cucumber and bell pepper to the bowl and toss to coat.
10. Divide between bowls and tuck some slices of avocado into each bowl for garnish.
protocol.name: buckwheat soba sesame noodle salad

instruction: 1. Dice the onion and the tofu.
2. Thinly slice the scallions, separating the whites from the greens.
3. Mince the garlic.
4. Remove the core from the cauliflower and allow it to dry completely.
5. Coarsely chop the cauliflower into florets.

6. Place the cauliflower into a food processor and pulse for about 30 seconds until the cauliflower is small and has the texture of rice or couscous. Be careful not to over process or the cauliflower will get mushy. Set aside.
7. Whisk the eggs in a small bowl and season with a pinch of salt.
8. Heat up half the sesame oil in large sauté pan or wok over medium heat.
9. Cook egg mixture until firm. Set aside.
10. Using the remaining sesame oil, sauté the onions, scallion whites, peas and garlic until tender, about 4 minutes.
11. Add the cauliflower "rice" to the pan along with Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce and tofu.
12. Cook for 5 to 6 minutes, stirring frequently, until the cauliflower is slightly crispy on the outside but tender on the inside.
13. Mix in the egg and gently fold in scallion greens.
14. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: cauliflower fried rice

instruction: 1. Toast the almonds in a large, ungreased frying pan over medium heat until golden brown.
2. Chop the cabbage, bell pepper and onions.
3. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Pour in the toasted sesame dressing and toss until everything is evenly coated.
4. Cover and place in the fridge until chilled. Mix again before serving.
protocol.name: colorful cabbage salad

instruction: 1. Prepare pasta according to package directions.
2. Chop cherry tomatoes and chili peppers.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the pasta, cabbage, tomatoes, chili peppers, peas and peanuts. Toss with the toasted sesame sauce, rice vinegar and chili oil until everything is evenly coated.
4. Cover and place in the fridge until ready to serve. Mix again before serving and garnish with crushed Aleppo pepper.
protocol.name: spicy bow tie salad

instruction: 1. Toast the almonds in a large, ungreased frying pan over medium heat until golden brown.
2. Thinly slice the red onion and the scallions.
3. Place slaw mix, onion and cranberries In a large mixing bowl.
4. Toss with Toasted Sesame sauce.
5. Gently fold in the almonds and scallions.
6. Enjoy at room temperature or refrigerate until ready to serve.
protocol.name: asian broccoli slaw

instruction: 1. Cook the noodles according to package instructions.
2. Drain and rinse with cold water. Set aside.
3. Peel, seed and slice the cucumber into matchsticks.
4. Thinly slice the scallions on the diagonal.
5. Grate the carrot.
6. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce, peanut butter, rice vinegar and sriracha until smooth.
7. Add the noodles, toss to coat.
8. Gently fold in the cucumber slices and carrots, and garnish with the scallions.
9. Serve immediately or chill until ready to eat.
protocol.name: peanut noodle salad

instruction: 1. Cut the stems off the portobello mushrooms and scrape out the gills.
2. In a bowl or large resealable container, toss the mushrooms with 6 tablespoons of the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce until thoroughly coated.
3. Cover and marinate in the fridge for about 30 minutes.
4. When the mushrooms are ready, discard any leftover marinade.
5. Prepare a charcoal grill for direct cooking over medium-high heat.
6. Grill the mushrooms for about 4 minutes on each side, until tender. Make sure to keep the grill covered as much as possible to ensure even cooking.
7. Place a slice of smoked gouda on each mushroom.
8. Cover and cook until cheese is melted.
9. Toast the buns on the grill until golden brown.
10. Remove and spread the remaining Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce on the bottom buns.
11. Place one mushroom cap on each bun, and top with a piece of butter lettuce and pickled red onion (optional).
12. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: grilled teriyaki portobello burgers with gouda
protocol.image: grilled teriyaki portobello burgers with gouda.jpg
integradient: whole wheat hamburger buns or other soft rolls

instruction: 1. Slice the scallions.
2. Prepare rice according to package instructions, replacing water with chicken stock and a tablespoon of Veri Veri Teriyaki Sauce.
3. Garnish with sliced scallions.
4. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: soy vay savory brown rice

instruction: 1. Preheat the oven to 425°F.
2. First, cut the tofu into 1/4 inch slices and place on paper towels to drain for about 10 minutes.
3. Arrange the tofu in a shallow dish or resealable plastic container.
4. Pour in Hoisin Garlic sauce and turn tofu until evenly coated.
5. Cover and marinate in the fridge for 20 minutes.
6. When tofu is ready, discard any leftover marinade.
7. Thinly slice the scallions.
8. Using a lipped cookie sheet, cook the tofu for about 40 minutes, turning once halfway through cooking.
9. Garnish with sesame seeds and scallions.
10. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: baked tofu

instruction: 1. Cut the tofu into 1/2 inch slices and place on paper towels to drain for 10 minutes.
2. Season both sides with salt and pepper.
3. Peel the oranges and slice them into bite-size pieces.
4. Chop the cabbage, cucumber and scallions.
5. Combine the fruit and vegetables in a large mixing bowl and toss with the toasted sesame sauce.
6. Lay a fresh layer of paper towels down for the tofu to drain once it's done cooking.
7. Heat up the olive oil in a large, non-stick frying pan over high heat.
8. Cook the tofu in one layer. Flip it once halfway through cooking until it's golden brown, about 3 minutes per side.
9. Remove and then place on the paper towels cool down.
10. Cut the finished tofu into thin slices.
11. Plate the vegetables and lay the tofu on top.
12. Garnish with peanuts.
13. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: tired of turkey tofu salad

instruction: 1. Grate the potatoes.
2. Take half the grated potatoes and chop finely.
3. Place all of the potatoes in a large mixing bowl and cover with water.
4. Let stand at least 15 minutes.
5. Dry the mixing bowl out with paper towels.
6. Place the potatoes back into the bowl.
7. Thinly slice the scallions.
8. Chop the onion.
9. Using a large frying pan, heat up about 1/4 inch of oil over medium heat.
10. Add the onion, eggs, Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce, salt, pepper, baking powder and flour to the potatoes
11. Stir well. Add more flour if too much liquid accumulates in the bottom of the bowl.
12. Spoon the potato mixture into the hot oil and press down lightly to flatten.
13. Fry until golden brown, about 4 minutes per side.
14. Transfer to paper towels to drain.
15. Repeat until the batter is used up.
16. Arrange the latkes on a platter with sour cream in a separate bowl for dipping.
17. Garnish with scallions.
18. Serve hot.
protocol.name: soy vay teri latkes

instruction: 1.  Chop up the mushrooms, carrots and red cabbage.
2. In a large mixing bowl, toss the chopped veggies with the spinach and Miso Vinaigrette dressing until everything is evenly coated.
protocol.name: mighty miso mushroom salad
integradient: sliced, fresh mushrooms (approx. one small package)

instruction: 1. Cook rice according to package instructions.
2. Chop the carrots.
3. Steam carrots in a double boiler or steamer until tender, about 3 minutes.
4. Slice eggplants in half lengthwise, then in strips.
5. Mince the green onions.
6. Remove gills and stems from the mushrooms.
7. Heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a large nonstick frying pan or wok over high heat.
8. Sauté the eggplant until softened and translucent.
9. Add green onions and cook until tender.
10. Remove mixture and set aside.
11. Brush mushrooms with remaining olive oil and add to pan.
12. Reduce heat to medium, cover and cook until soft, about 4 minutes per side.
13. Remove mushrooms from pan and set aside.
14. Turn heat back up to high, add wine and let it partially reduce.
15. Stir in Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce and cook until thickened.
16. Return the eggplant mixture to the pan and sauté until everything’s evenly coated and heated through.
17. Place the mushrooms top down and stuff with eggplant mixture.
18. Serve with rice and steamed carrots.
protocol.name: portobello and eggplant stir fry
integradient: Chinese or Japanese (or other small) eggplants

instruction: 1. Toast the almonds in a large ungreased frying pan over medium heat.
2. Dice the zucchini and red onion.
3. Prepare quinoa according to package directions. Stir in the zucchini during the last 5 minutes of cooking so it becomes tender.
4. Remove from the heat and transfer the quinoa and zucchini into a large mixing bowl.
5. Stir in the red onion, toasted almonds and Toasted Sesame sauce.
6. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
7. Serve immediately at room temperature or refrigerate until ready to eat.
protocol.name: toasted sesame quinoa salad with zucchini
protocol.image: toasted sesame quinoa salad with zucchini.jpg

instruction: 1. Strip the leaves from the kale stalks and chop into bite-size pieces, about 1-2 inches wide.
2. Thinly slice the red cabbage, Napa cabbage and apple. Set aside.
3. For the croutons: Slice the bialys into 1/2 inch cubes.
4. Heat butter or oil in a large non-stick frying pan or wok over low heat.
5. Add the bialys cubes, and cook until they're golden brown.
6. Place on a paper towel to drain excess oil.
7. Salt and pepper to taste.
8. For the dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together the Toasted Sesame sauce, the juice of 1 lemon (approx. 2 tablespoons), mustard and salt. Set aside.
9. Place the kale, cabbages and apple in a large salad bowl.
10. Toss to coat with dressing.
11. Salad can be made up to one day in advance. (The kale will become more tender the longer it sits in the dressing.)
12. When you’re ready to eat, top the salad with croutons and garnish with sesame seeds and fried onions.
13. Serve cold.
protocol.name: toasted sesame kale cabbage salad

instruction: 1. Preheat oven to broil (approx. 450°F).
2. Soak wooden skewers in water (at least 30 minutes).
3. Peel and cut the eggplant into 1 inch cubes.
4. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the coconut milk, peanut butter and teriyaki sauce. Set aside.
5. Coat the foil-lined baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray.
6. Thread four pieces of eggplant on each skewer.
7. Spread out on baking sheet and brush all four sides of each skewer with olive oil.
8. Season with a little bit of salt and pepper.
9. Brush the tops of the eggplant skewers with the sauce and place in the oven.
10. Broil for about 4 minutes, flipping a quarter turn after each minute and brushing exposed sides with more sauce. Cook until golden brown.
11. Remove from oven, cool slightly, and serve with extra sauce for dipping.
protocol.name: eggplant satay with coconut teriyaki

instruction: 1. Cook ramen noodles in boiling water until tender but firm, about 4 minutes.
2. Drain and set aside. Reserve the seasoning packets.
3. Shred the cabbage and carrots.
4. Slice the bamboo shoots and green onions. Set aside.
5. Heat the vegetable oil in a large nonstick frying pan or wok over medium-high heat.
6. Sauté the cabbage, carrots, bamboo shoots, green onions, ginger, garlic and bean sprouts until tender.
7. Add the Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce, soy sauce, sherry and one of the ramen seasoning packets.
8. Toss well to coat with the sauce.
9. Cook until everything is warmed through.
10. Serve immediately.
protocol.name: saucy vegetable chow mein
integradient: ramen noodle soup mix, any flavor

instruction: 1. Preheat oven to 250ºF
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cereal, goldfish crackers, sesame sticks and peanuts.
3. Mix in Veri Veri Teriyaki sauce into the melted butter.
4. Pour over the snack mixture and toss until everything is evenly coated.
5. Transfer the mix onto two lightly greased baking sheets.
6. Bake for about 30 minutes, stirring frequently.
7. Transfer to paper towels to cool.
8. Serve at room temperature.
protocol.name: soy vay snack mix
